description: growling lion/demon face with gold and red skin, very wide nose and gold teeth; large red tongue; upper palate, irises, nostrils and ear canals cut out
inscription:
Inscription

on back of forehead, incised: symbol
medium: Wood, pigments, lacquer, gofun, gilt metal
text: This mask is of Shichiguchi, one of a pair of lions who serve Manjusri (Monju in Japanese), the Buddhist bodhisattva of wisdom. In the Noh play Shakkyō, the lions cavort on a stage strewn with peony blossoms. The powerful dance of these heavenly creatures is said to dispel all evil.
title: Noh Mask of Shichiguchi
